boat.full_description:
Built by her first owner, Peter Martinez, in his Hampshire garden, and named 'Lucinda' after his wife, the first home built Cornish Crabber Pilot Cutter was launched at Deacons Boatyard, Bursledon in 1986. She was then taken to the Mayflower Marina, Plymouth. Designer, Roger Dongrey came to visit and inspect the work during the build.

An advert for her sale was placed in the OGA Newsletter, Gaffers Log, 1989/2:

Cornish Pilot Cutter P5 (Cornish Crabbers Ltd.) 30' LOA with six berths, pressurised water system, echosounder, log etc., dinghy with outboard. Decca Navigator and other extras if required. Lying Plymouth £36,000.
boat.name: Lucinda

ownerships.note: P Martinez was the first owner. At some stage William Jewel became owner and he sold her to Paul Raine.
ownerships.text: P Martinez was the first owner. At some stage William Jewel became owner and he sold her to Paul Raine.

boat.short_description: Lucinda is a Cornish Crabber Pilot Cutter 30 built in 1986 by Peter Martinez, her first owner.
